comments.creator: jhopkins@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Steps to reproduce:
- compose a new message in HTML mode
- click on body text
- Format | List | Definition
- type in four lines

Expected:
- a definition list like this:
term1
   definition1
term2
   definition2

Actual:
   term1
definition1
   term2
definition2


Discovered on Thunderbird 3.1.11 / Windows XP as well as Thunderbird 6.0b1 /Linux 32-bit

comments.author: jsabash@bellatlantic.net
comments.text:
It seems that "Format | List | Definition" refers to the tag type <dd>, and not to the list type <dl> that you are trying to compose.
If you start with "Format | List | Term"
Then the lines typed produce an alternating Term/List sequence.

Tested in:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.0; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110807 Thunderbird/8.0a1 ID:20110807030034
But I'm quite sure that code hasn't changed.
comments.raw_text:
It seems that "Format | List | Definition" refers to the tag type <dd>, and not to the list type <dl> that you are trying to compose.
If you start with "Format | List | Term"
Then the lines typed produce an alternating Term/List sequence.

Tested in:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.0; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110807 Thunderbird/8.0a1 ID:20110807030034
But I'm quite sure that code hasn't changed.

Confirmed that starting with "Format | List | Term" works as you describe.

The items under "Format | List" should apply at the list level (as opposed to the list item level), so "Term" seems out of place.

I suggest that the Definition menu item should take on the current Term functionality, and that the Term menu item should then be removed.
